title: SEC delays decision on Grayscale's proposal for spot Ethereum ETF again, with order to institute proceedings and seek public comment - The Block
summary: The SEC has delayed its decision on Grayscale's proposal for a spot Ethereum ETF for the second time, with a new deadline of 21 days for public comment and a rebuttal period of 35 days. The agency is seeking input on whether Ethereum's proof of stake mechanism and concentration of control could raise fraud and manipulation concerns. The SEC has also delayed decisions on other proposed spot Ethereum funds from BlackRock and Fidelity. Crypto experts are divided on the likelihood of a spot ether ETF approval, with some predicting an approval as early as May following the approval of spot bitcoin ETFs earlier this month.

title: Axiom, Protocol for Historical Ethereum Data, Raises $20M, Led by Paradigm, Standard Crypto - CoinDesk
summary: Axiom, a zero-knowledge proof protocol for historical Ethereum data, has raised $20M led by Paradigm and Standard Crypto. The technology allows for verification of transactions without revealing sensitive information, unlocking new markets and potential use cases. Co-founder Alok Vasudev notes that zero-knowledge proofs are like a computer providing a receipt for its actions, and Axiom's technology has the potential to open up new areas and markets.

title: Coinbase's Layer-2 Struggles, Polygon Closes In on Ethereum's User Growth - Yahoo Finance
summary: Coinbase's layer-2 scaling solution, Base, has struggled to gain traction with under 2 million users since launch, while Polygon has onboarded 15 million new users in 2023, almost rivaling Ethereum's growth. Despite this, Ethereum still leads with 15.4 million new users. Polygon's explosive user growth demonstrates the potential of layer-2 technology, and its multi-year head start in building its developer ecosystem may give it an advantage over Base.

title: Ethereum Price Forecast – Ethereum Continues to Hang Around The 50-day EMA - FX Empire
summary: Ethereum price forecast: Ethereum continues to fluctuate around the 50-day moving average, according to FX Empire. title: SEC's Delay on BlackRock Ethereum ETF Decision Signals Cautious Stance - Blockchain.News
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

SEC delays decision on BlackRock's Ethereum ETF to March 10, signaling cautious approach to crypto investment products.

The delay is part of a broader trend of postponements by the SEC, with significant attention focused on May 23 for further decisions.

Industry insiders are optimistic about eventual approval, but others are skeptical due to the SEC's generally hostile attitude towards the crypto industry.

The decision-making process highlights the ongoing debate about the classification and regulation of cryptocurrencies as securities.

Investors and market watchers are closely observing the SEC's moves, as they could set precedents for future cryptocurrency-related financial products.

title: Galaxy predicts 'unprecedented challenges' for Ethereum in 2024 - crypto.news
summary: Galaxy Digital predicts Ethereum will face "unprecedented challenges" in 2024 due to emerging layer-1 blockchains like Solana. Ethereum's modular architecture may introduce new technological risks, and the network may need to make changes to staking dynamics and monetary policy if usage surges. Other networks like Celestia offer greater flexibility in catering to diverse user needs.

title: SEC Delays Ruling on Grayscale, BlackRock Ethereum ETFs - Yahoo Finance
summary: The SEC has delayed rulings on Grayscale and BlackRock's Ethereum ETF applications due to a need for additional analysis. The agency is seeking public input on concerns around manipulation and liquidity in the ETH markets. The delay comes after the SEC approved 11 spot bitcoin ETFs earlier this year. Ether and bitcoin prices are flat, with ETH at $2,220 and BTC at $39,900.

title: Ethereum Price is Primed For a Correction And Only 1 Thing is Holding it Back - NewsBTC
summary: Ethereum price is attempting an upside correction, with the potential to gain momentum if it clears the $2,240 resistance zone. However, the price is currently trading below this level and the 100-hourly Simple Moving Average, with the 23.6% Fib retracement level of the downward move serving as resistance. If the price fails to clear the $2,240 resistance, it could start another decline, potentially reaching the $2,165 support level or lower. Technical indicators, such as the MACD and RSI, are losing momentum in the bearish zone, indicating potential for further downside. Major support levels are at $2,165, while major resistance levels are at $2,240 and $2,360.

title: SEC delays decision on BlackRock's Ethereum spot ETF launch - crypto.news
summary: The SEC has delayed its decision on BlackRock's application to launch a spot Ethereum ETF until March 10, 2024, due to a lack of time to review the application details. This is the second delay in the decision, with the previous one occurring on January 19, 2024. While some companies, such as BlackRock, have filed papers to open an Ethereum-based spot fund, the SEC has expressed uncertainty about the asset's status, citing its "opaque" nature. The media expects the SEC to approve the launch of spot Ethereum ETFs by the end of summer 2024, but the process is complicated by the uncertain status of Ethereum.

title: BlackRock's Ethereum ETF Dreams Deferred as SEC Seeks More Time - CCN.com
summary: The SEC has delayed its decision on BlackRock's proposed spot Ethereum ETF until early 2024, citing ongoing scrutiny and regulatory considerations surrounding cryptocurrency ETFs. The decision is expected by March 2024, and the SEC has not received any public comments on the proposal. Despite the delay, there is still optimism among ETF issuers and a 54% likelihood of approval by May 31, according to Polymarket. The SEC's decision on Ethereum ETFs is expected by May, and the agency is also expected to make decisions on other similar applications around this time. The delay could affect other spot Ethereum ETF applications with deadlines from May 23 to August 3, 2024. The concept of an Ethereum ETF is to offer investors exposure to Ethereum, the second-largest cryptocurrency by market capitalization, and some analysts view the approval of such funds as a sign of growing crypto adoption.

title: Recovery Dim? Ethereum Faces Potential Slide Towards $2,000 - NewsBTC
summary: Ethereum faces potential slide to $2,000 as it struggles with technical challenges and looming resistance levels. Despite positive market sentiment and record-high net profits locked in, the cryptocurrency's value is teetering on the edge of a decisive crossroads. The path forward remains uncertain, with a potential slide towards $2,000 and a resurgence of the market as possible outcomes.

title: Blackrock's Ethereum ETF Delayed by SEC -- ETH Price Stable After 20% Downfall - CCN.com
summary:

Another low of $2,100 is likely in the coming days, followed by a correction to the upside. The target for this correction is $1,840, based on the Fibonacci retracement tool. This is happening as Ethereum (ETH) and Bitcoin (BTC) are experiencing significant selling pressure, with Ethereum (ETH) losing nearly $33M in value over the past week and Bitcoin (BTC) slumping under $39k. The article suggests that investors are turning to Kelexo (KLXO) as a more promising investment opportunity due to its novel peer-to-peer lending and borrowing protocol, which aims to help the unbanked and revolutionize the lending process. However, the article also notes that investing in cryptocurrency carries risks and that it is important to conduct thorough research before making any investment decisions.

title: Ethereum Developers Set Timeline for Final 'Dencun' Testnet Upgrades - CoinDesk
summary: Ethereum developers have set a timeline for the final "Dencun" testnet upgrades, with the goal of improving the network's scalability and performance. The upgrades are expected to be completed by the end of 2024, and will be tested on the Dencun testnet before being deployed on the mainnet. CoinDesk's Consensus 2024 event will bring together industry leaders and experts to discuss the latest developments in the crypto and blockchain space. Register and buy your pass now at consensus.coindesk.com.

title: Ethereum Developers Discuss Post-Dencun Proposals, Including Increasing Maximum Stake From 32 to 2,048 ETH ... - Unchained
summary: Ethereum developers are discussing proposals for the next upgrade, Electra, including increasing the maximum stake from 32 to 2,048 ETH, addressing censorship in block production, and scaling up data availability. They are also prioritizing EIP-7002, which allows validators to trigger exits through their execution layer withdrawal credentials. However, EIP-7547, which aims to make Ethereum more censorship-resistant, was removed from consideration due to lack of support.

title: Ethereum (ETH) Developers Make Big Announcement, What It Pertains To - U.Today
summary: Ethereum developers have announced the upcoming activation of the Dencun upgrade on the Sepolia and Holesky testnets. The upgrade includes changes to both the consensus and execution layers, including the implementation of ephemeral data blobs, which will help reduce L2 transaction fees. The upgrade is expected to activate on the Ethereum mainnet next, following smooth activation on the testnets. Additionally, Ethereum momentum is expected to pick up in the coming weeks, with factors such as Bitcoin's bottoming out, the buzz around the Ethereum Spot ETF, and the implementation of new upgrades that will lower transaction fees by 90%.

title: Bitcoin and Ethereum decline on the week, Worldcoin to launch a new Orb and Terraform Labs files for bankruptcy - TechCrunch
summary: Bitcoin and Ethereum declined this week, with Bitcoin down 7% and Ethereum down 13.5%. The global crypto market cap remained relatively unchanged at around $1.55 trillion. In the NFT space, sales volume decreased 16.4% but the number of buyers and sellers increased by 50%. Binance is facing a lawsuit from the US Securities and Exchange Commission, with the judge pushing back on some of their arguments. Solana Labs sold out its Saga phone within 30 hours of launch, with over 40,000 preorders. Polymer Labs raised $23M to build out Ethereum's interoperability, while Masa raised $5.4M to build a personal data network. Scene Infrastructure Company raised $3M from a16z to expand the utility of its FWB token, and Arcade2Earn raised $4.8M in a private token round. Ingonyama raised $21 million to improve zero-knowledge technology.

title: Approval for Ethereum ETFs Coming Soon? Key Challenges You Should Know - Coinpedia Fintech News
summary: The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) is considering approving a spot Ethereum ETF, but there are challenges and uncertainties surrounding the decision. While some experts are optimistic about the approval, others are more cautious due to the regulatory gray area surrounding Ethereum. The SEC is expected to make a decision in May, but it could take longer. Market experts offer varied perspectives on the likelihood of approval, with some assigning a 70% chance and others being more cautious. Bitwise, a company entrenched in Bitcoin ETFs, shares optimism about an Ethereum ETF, but acknowledges the unique challenges it faces. Skeptics argue that the SEC's historical delays in approving cryptocurrency matters cast doubt on a swift approval for an Ethereum ETF.

title: BlackRock Ethereum ETF Joins the Wait as SEC Delays Decision - DailyCoin
summary: The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has delayed its decision on BlackRock's Ethereum ETF proposal, extending the deadline to March 10, 2024. The SEC has also delayed Fidelity's ETF proposal, and investors are optimistic about the potential approval of the financial instrument despite the delays. BlackRock CEO Larry Fink has endorsed Ethereum as a "store" of value, and Valkyrie Investments has expressed interest in the Ethereum ecosystem. SEC Commissioner Hester Peirce has expressed optimism about a balanced decision-making process for all proposals. However, the SEC has expressed concerns about potential market manipulation, which may influence its current evaluation of Ethereum ETFs. The approval of Ethereum ETFs could signal improved regulatory standards within the United States.

title: Ethereum (ETH) Price Defends $2k Support as Whales Buy the Dip - crypto.news
summary: Ethereum (ETH) price has held steady above $2,000 despite a broader market downturn, with on-chain signals suggesting rising whale demand. Ethereum whale activity has been high despite the downtrend, providing market liquidity and reinforcing confidence among small-scale retail traders. Additionally, there has been a decline in exchange reserves, with 150,000 ETH worth $330 million moved into long-term storage or staking contracts. The ETH price prediction suggests that the currency may be in a prime position to defend the $2,000 territory, with the potential for a rebound if prices slide towards $2,100. However, the upside potential is limited, with bulls unlikely to overturn the bearish pressure without reclaiming the $2,500 territory.

title: Ethereum’s Strong Support at This Crucial Level Paves the Way for Potential Upside - ZyCrypto
summary: Ethereum (ETH) is facing a challenging start to the week, down 3% in value. Despite this, analysts are optimistic about the potential for upside, with a key demand zone at $2,388-2,460 providing support. If the price can hold here, it could lead to minimal resistance and a pathway for upward movement. However, if ETH fails to sustain this level, the next significant support area is at $2,000. The imminent deadline for a Spot Ethereum ETF, just four months away, could be a game-changer for mainstream adoption and institutional investment in ETH. Despite Bitcoin's recent drop following its spot ETF approval, the ETH/BTC pair has surged by 26% and is holding firm. At press time, ETH was trading at $2,221, down 2.98% over the past 24 hours.

title: Spot Ethereum ETF: US SEC Delays BlackRock's Application - CoinGape
summary: The US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has delayed its decision on BlackRock's spot Ethereum exchange-traded fund (ETF) application, now scheduled for March 10, 2024. The SEC seeks additional time to deliberate on the application, citing the need to make an informed decision. This delay follows a similar postponement from rival Fidelity Investments. The emergence of spot Bitcoin ETF has fueled optimism and debate on the prospects of spot Ethereum ETFs in the US, with some commissioners expressing a willingness to learn from past mistakes. While the approval of Ethereum ETFs is uncertain, proponents believe a precedent has been set with BlackRock's application, and speculation grows that an XRP spot ETF might also be on the horizon.

title: Ethereum Scaling Protocol AltLayer Airdrops $100M Worth of Tokens - Yahoo Finance
summary: AltLayer, a decentralized Ethereum scaling protocol, has launched an $100M airdrop of its ALT tokens to eligible community members. The airdrop is open until Feb 25 and includes 300M ALT tokens. Participants include AltLayer OG Badge NFT holders, Oh Ottie! NFT holders, AltLayer Altitude campaign participants, EigenLayer restakers, and Celestia stakers. The ALT token was launched via Binance Launchpool and has gained 11.7% in price, reaching $0.3126. This airdrop comes amid a recent resurgence of airdrops in the market, fueled by a Q4 2023 rally.

title: SEC delays Ethereum ETF approval as ETH faces six-day downtrend - AMBCrypto News
summary: The SEC has delayed the approval of BlackRock's spot Ethereum ETF, extending the decision by 45 days. This is not an isolated case, as Fidelity's proposal has also received a similar extension. The delays are expected to continue in the upcoming months, with major decisions potentially unfolding in May. Meanwhile, Ethereum's price has persisted in a six-day downtrend, with a weakening trend indicated by its RSI.

title: Crypto Trader Updates Outlook on Bitcoin and Ethereum, Says BTC’s Correction in ‘Final Stages’ - The Daily Hodl
summary: Crypto trader Michaël van de Poppe predicts that Bitcoin (BTC) is in the final stages of its correction, with volatility decreasing and upward momentum likely. The next halving event in April 2024 could also have a positive impact on BTC's price. Additionally, van de Poppe believes that Ethereum (ETH) will gain steam in the next few weeks, driven by factors such as Bitcoin's bottoming out, Ethereum Spot ETF hype, and upcoming cost reductions. At the time of writing, BTC is worth $39,676 and ETH is worth $2,186.

title: SEC pushes back BlackRock's spot ether ETF decision - CNBC
summary: The SEC has pushed back BlackRock's decision on a spot ether ETF, according to CNBC. The decision was initially expected in the first half of 2023, but the regulator has now pushed it back to a later date. The SEC has not provided a new timeline for the decision.

title: Ethereum Is The Biggest Winner In Post-ETF Approval Market: Glassnode - NewsBTC
summary: Ethereum has emerged as the biggest winner in the post-ETF approval market, according to Glassnode. Despite Bitcoin's struggles since the approval of spot ETFs, Ethereum has outperformed both Bitcoin and altcoins in terms of market cap dominance. The chart shows that Ethereum's dominance against Bitcoin has increased by 2.9% since the latter's spot ETFs gained approval. Additionally, Ethereum has gained 4.2% in global dominance, making it the biggest winner in the post-ETF market. Ethereum's price is currently trading at around $2,230, up 1% in the last 24 hours. However, the token has plunged over the last couple of days.

title: ETH ETFs Are Inevitable — But When? - CoinDesk
summary: The SEC has not explicitly mentioned Ethereum (ETH) in its lawsuits against crypto exchanges, suggesting it may classify it as a commodity rather than a security. This could lead to a regulatory fight with the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC), which also claims jurisdiction over ETH. Despite this uncertainty, ETH ETFs are seen as inevitable, but their launch may be delayed due to regulatory hurdles.

title: Spot Ether ETF Applications Decisions Delayed by SEC - CoinDesk
summary: The SEC has delayed decisions on Spot Ether ETF applications, focusing on market manipulation and correlation between spot and futures markets. Questions also surround the significance of the CME futures market. Similar to Bitcoin ETF reviews, the SEC is seeking answers on these matters.

title: Ethereum ETF Approval Left Hanging as SEC Pushes Back BlackRock Proposal - Coinpedia Fintech News
summary: The SEC has approved a Bitcoin ETF, but has pushed back on approving an Ethereum ETF, citing a need for more time to consider the proposal. The SEC is facing legal battles with major crypto players like Binance, Coinbase, and Ripple, and has refused to comment on the ongoing court hearings. The SEC has extended the decision deadline for BlackRock's proposed Ethereum ETF to March 10, 2024. Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse has expressed concerns about the potential challenges of getting an ETF approved, citing the need for a court intervention in the case of the Bitcoin ETF.

title: Axiom secures $20m for Ethereum data access - crypto.news
summary: Axiom, an Ethereum data protocol, has secured $20 million in Series A funding for its zero-knowledge proofs technology. Axiom's innovation allows smart contract developers to access historical Ethereum data without directly accessing the blockchain, enhancing efficiency and addressing limitations of Ethereum's smart contracts. The funding will be used to enhance the protocol and expand the team. Notable investors include Paradigm and Standard Crypto.

title: Ethereum Dencun Upgrade Q1 Release on Track? Developers Confirm Schedule Despite Initial Snags - DailyCoin
summary: Ethereum's Dencun upgrade is still on track for a Q1 2024 mainnet release, despite initial challenges experienced during its first testnet outing on Goerli. Developers have confirmed the schedule and urged validators to upgrade to Dencun-supported clients to ensure a smooth upgrade experience. The Dencun upgrade will introduce proto-danksharding, which aims to reduce fees for end users by shaving the cost of data storage on the mainnet. While unforeseen challenges on Sepolia and Holesky could still impact the upgrade timeline, the recent announcement from developers suggests that the upgrade is still on track.

title: SEC Chair Pours Cold Water on Chances of Spot Ethereum ETF Approval - Coinspeaker
summary: SEC Chair Gary Gensler poured cold water on the chances of an Ethereum ETF approval, stating that the recent Bitcoin ETF approval is limited to one commodity and cannot be interpreted as having broader implications. The SEC has delayed its decision on BlackRock's spot Ethereum ETF proposal, pushing the deadline to March 10. Crypto experts remain confident that a spot Ethereum ETF could be approved this year, but the SEC is embroiled in legal battles with multiple crypto firms, including Binance, Coinbase, and Ripple. The SEC chair warned investors to be aware and careful when investing in crypto securities, as non-compliant token operators may not provide adequate disclosures.

title: Ethereum Dencun Upgrade Coming to 2 More Test Networks by Early February - Unchained - Unchained
summary: Ethereum's Dencun upgrade is set to expand to two additional test networks, Sepolia and Holesky, by early February. This brings the upgrade one step closer to mainnet. Dencun, the largest Ethereum upgrade this year, will introduce a new transaction type called a blob-carrying transaction, which is expected to lower the cost of transacting on Ethereum by allowing rollups to add cheaper data to blocks. The upgrade is named after Deneb and Cancun, and is expected to scale the Ethereum blockchain by implementing EIP-4844.

summary:

Goldman Sachs' Global Head of Digital Assets, Mathew McDermott, expresses optimism about potential approval of spot Ethereum ETFs in coming months.

summary:

The SEC has not made any decisions on spot Ethereum ETFs before March. The next important date to watch is May 23. BlackRock's application was filed in November 2023.

title: Despite Massive Exchange Deposits Of Ethereum, ETH Staking Stats Hits 29,128,513.51 ETH - NullTX
summary: Despite a decline in Ethereum's price, the cryptocurrency's staking activity has reached a new high. Celsius has deposited a significant amount of Ethereum to centralized exchanges, maintaining a large holding. The latest data from intotheblock shows that approximately 29,128,513.51 ETH has been staked in January 2024, representing a 24.29% increase in staking participation rate. These developments highlight the dynamic nature of the Ethereum market, where various factors contribute to its evolving landscape.

title: Ethereum Developers Confirm Dencun Upgrade Testnet Trial Dates - Milk Road
summary: Ethereum developers have announced testnet trial dates for the Dencun network upgrade, which includes key features to boost scalability and reduce transaction costs. The upgrade will be tested on Sepolia and Goerli test blockchains before being deployed on the mainnet. If successful, the upgrade is expected to be implemented in late February or early March. The Dencun upgrade will introduce Proto-danksharding, cheaper data availability, and other technical changes to increase Ethereum's baseline capability and flexibility for developers. However, thorough testing is necessary to ensure stability and avoid potential bugs and disruptions.

title: Is Celsius' Ethereum Dumping Spree Cause for Concern? - DailyCoin
summary: Celsius, a bankrupt crypto lender, has been transferring large amounts of Ethereum (ETH) to exchanges, causing concerns among investors about a potential sell-off. Despite the moves, it is unlikely that Celsius will sell all of its ETH as it is committed to settling most creditor claims and retail customer assets with a mix of liquid crypto assets, including ETH. The firm's restructuring plan names Coinbase as a distribution partner, and it is unclear when asset distribution will begin. Former Celsius customers have expressed concerns about the capabilities of the firm assigned to manage a new creditor-owned Bitcoin mining firm, and some argue that the firm is in a weakened financial position.

title: News Explorer — Ethereum Options Bearish and Out of Sync With Analyst Predictions - Decrypt
summary:

title: Ethereum Dencun Upgrade Timelines Shared For Sepolia and Holesky Testnets – Mainnet Next? - Cryptonews
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum is set to undergo a hard fork called Dencun, which will introduce new features such as "proto-danksharding" and improve scaling solutions. The upgrade will first be tested on the Sepolia and Holesky testnets before being deployed on the mainnet. The testing phase is expected to begin on January 30 and February 7, respectively. If successful, the Dencun upgrade will introduce more efficient data storage and reduce transaction fees for layer-2 scaling solutions. Meanwhile, the approval of an Ethereum spot ETF has been delayed, but many anticipate its eventual approval.

title: SEC Pushes Decision On BlackRock’s Spot Ethereum ETF Proposal To March - ZyCrypto
summary: The SEC has extended the deadline for its decision on BlackRock's proposed spot Ethereum ETF to March 10, pushing back the initial Jan. 25 deadline. This is the first of several possible delays within a 240-day period. Other companies, such as Ark Invest, VanEck, Fidelity, and Grayscale, are also seeking to launch their own Ethereum ETFs. Despite some delays, strategists predict that ETH ETF applications will be successful, as the legal arguments that led to the approval of Bitcoin ETFs will likely apply to Ether as well. SEC Commissioner Hester Peirce has suggested that a court battle may not be necessary to convince the Commission to approve spot Ether applications, as the approach is not arbitrary or capricious. If approved, it would be the first time professional American investors can gain exposure to Ether, further legitimizing its status in mainstream finance and leading to increased interest and investment in Ether-based projects.
